content.body: annevk5: ping
annevk5: what kind of license is used for Opera's tests?
Hixie!
Object.create([some cross-origin window object]) should do what? Browsers seem split on thisâ€¦
(i.e., "opinions?")
hober, basically with those editorial issues like 150 I would very much prefer someone to set a spec-wide style guide rather than micromanaging individual editors
micromanaging individual editors is a huge waste of time
smaug, depends on the tests
smaug, I let Mozilla use mine under whichever license they want I think per some statement in a bug
I think some others might be licensed under Apache 2.0 or some such
not really up to speed with those
annevk: For the HTML WG testsuite ones?
well those are licensed under whatever the W3C wants I reckon
I meant http://testsuites.opera.com/
annevk: I mean what tests was smaug asking about
"Unless otherwise noted, all material on testsuites.opera.com is shared under the Apache License, Version 2.0."
I doubt he would be asking about HTML WG tests
prolly XHR or EventSource
smaug____, see logs
did anyone see any kind of conclusion in the Exceptions thread?
I still have no idea whether to change DOM Core
and how
Hixie, are you around btw?
Hixie, I was wondering whether you have some kind of list of things that are wrong with DOM Traversal
annevk, didn't seem to have a conclusion yet, although I think most people seem convinced the "instanceof Blah" checking is bad
annevk: so it is ok to take your tests and modify them to work with mochitests ?
heycam, yeah that's what I got out of it too
do I need to add some license text and mention copyright Opera ?
smaug____, yeah, though preferably that is done via the separate javascript file
smaug____, i mean the idea is that we use this framework for all tests
smaug____, no that's not needed
annevk: thanks
annevk: not specially. it just needs rewriting to actually be defined.
k
anyone know if a good way to feature detect svg as a css background image?
s/if/og/
sighs
just assume it's supported?
maybe I should just do that
